transportAdvice: Anguilla has no formal public transit system, so getting around relies on taxis and car rentals, both of which are widely available; driving is on the left side of the road. Walking is practical within small villages and beach areas, but a vehicle is generally needed to explore the island fully.

weather.description: Dry and pleasant with gentle trade winds making it one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Consistently sunny and dry with refreshing breezes, ideal beach weather throughout.
Warm and largely rain-free, marking the tail end of the peak dry season.
Temperatures begin to rise slightly but conditions remain dry and very enjoyable.
Warmth increases and occasional showers begin to appear as the wet season approaches.
Early hurricane season brings higher humidity and more frequent passing showers.
Hot and humid with periodic rain showers, though long sunny spells are still common.
Peak hurricane season with the highest chance of heavy rain and tropical storm activity.
The wettest and most climatically risky month, with elevated hurricane threat and frequent downpours.
Still within hurricane season with significant rain probability, though storms begin to taper off late in the month.
Hurricane risk diminishes and conditions gradually improve, with a mix of sun and occasional showers.
Dry season returns with comfortable temperatures and reliable sunshine, making it a popular time to visit.
